block.p: Cristina Portale, the daughter of Carol and Carl Portale of Harrison, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher Michael Cocozziello, the son of Patricia and Pat Macri of Oakwood, Staten Island. The Rev. Jack Arlotta performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection in Rye, N.Y.

Mrs. Cocozziello, 27, is the senior sales executive in Manhattan for Rene Lezard, the German fashion company. She graduated from Ithaca College. Her father is the senior vice president and publisher of Elle magazine in Manhattan. Her mother is the vice president for national fund-raising for the March of Dimes in White Plains.

The Rev. Jack Arlotta performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection in Rye, N.Y.

Mrs. Cocozziello, 27, is the senior sales executive in Manhattan for Rene Lezard, the German fashion company. She graduated from Ithaca College. Her father is the senior vice president and publisher of Elle magazine in Manhattan. Her mother is the vice president for national fund-raising for the March of Dimes in White Plains.

Mr. Cocozziello, 30, is a lawyer at Pfizer, the pharmaceuticals company in Manhattan. He is also an owner of Ryan McFadden's and Tammany Hall, Manhattan restaurants. He graduated from Hofstra University and New York Law School. His mother is an executive assistant at the Carnegie Corporation of New York. His father is the general manager at Bay Ridge Lexus in Brooklyn.
